Reviews.Title: finally, a powerful tablet capable of producing!
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie Adams
Reviews.Content: I've held off on buying a tablet for a couple years for one main reason - lack of ability to produce. While this is my first tablet i'm not sure tablets get any better than this, right now. I am completely satisfied with its capabilities.  I wanted something smaller and lighter than a netbook. but it had to be able to produce for work. seems like the majority of tablets on the market are marketed toward the entertainment end - videos, games, net surfing. i needed something i can produce and modify products on. this is it. This machine can handle .docx/.pptx/.xlsx files with ease and even creates them.A couple comments - if bloatware drives you insane, you might want to research which products are out there that don't stack their offerings with bloatware. this thing came with lots of stuff i can't get rid of. with only 16gb of on board memory, 6gb is taken up by the operating system and some of this bloaware. only 10gb are left for internal storage. not all apps can be placed on the SD card. if i had the 32gb i'd still make that complaint. i resolved this with the next comment.This edition (2014) of the Note accepts 64gb SD cards. There is some question out there as to whether or not it does. Mine accepts with no issue a 64gb PNY SDXC micro. No reformatting, no special app, no nothing. not sure if they accept higher than 64gb. if they do, that's even better capability. i'm not a big fan of loading up on apps that get used once a month so keeping 10gb of space available inside with the remainder on the card is more than plenty for the average user. if this isnt enough you might want to rethink what you are storing. do you really listen to 25gb of music. probably not. there are also other wireless storage options out there now that might make for a nice pairing with a tablet if you really need more storage.If you are on the fence about "useful" tablets like i have been, this is the tablet to take you off the fence. Pair this tablet with a wifi keyboard/case and you're golden. there are a number of keyboard\case combos out there for about $35 that are pretty sweet and they work well. I really can't see myself ever traveling again with a laptop.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this product!!  It meets all my expectations and I would recommend it for others! Also arrived quickly.

Reviews.Title: The best out there !!
Reviews.Author: Juan Rojas
Reviews.Content: Simply the best you can get..The freedom of customizing the unit as you want is something that makes you love it..Support for the majority of your portable needs..

Reviews.Title: gh
Reviews.Author: gina lynn hayslip
Reviews.Content: very pleased with purchase very compatible with my galaxy phone  i didn't even know all the things that could be done by combing the two

Reviews.Title: trying to master it's capabilities is a challenge for us ederly less tech savvy.
Reviews.Author: Stephen C. Sisk
Reviews.Content: I am used to having a print instruction manual and was not about to print out the on-line manual. I am slowly learning the system and adding apps as needed.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for Student
Reviews.Author: DowntownSF
Reviews.Content: This tablet is perfect for taking notes in class. At first I wasn't sure that a tablet could be used for effectively taking notes during class but now I'm sold on the concept.Pros:Ability to send/save notes to yourself/others in multiple formats.Picks up writing smoothly and accurately.Nice formula match ability, useful for math notes.Multiple pen, marker, highlighting types and sizes to get your notes looking just right.Can write directly on screen shots of anything with the air-command menu(useful for pdf books).Cons:Can only take notes in landscape at the moment(not really a problem but might bother some people).Gets a little hot after a few hours of note taking.If multiple programs are in memory the writing can become laggy.Tips for note taking:Lock your notebooks!(Accidentally deleted one, the lock will force you to enter a code to confirm deletion).Adjust the pen width to the smallest size and zoom in on the notebook page(looks a lot better when you convert to pdf).Take notes and use the internet or look at a pdf at the same time by using the samsung sidebar.Hit the Save button before you exit! Auto-save is not constant.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet if you need a pen
Reviews.Author: C. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I have read hours of reviews. I found good & bad to each review. Having the Note 2, I wanted to give this tablet a try. To me it operates like my Note 2. I really enjoy my note 2 and the tablet is no different. If you have a Note device and don't Use the Pen, Save yourself some money and get a Tab Tablet. I Use the pen about 80% of the time, so itis natural for me.Over all the operating system is smooth. I find little to no lag when swyping or accessing apps. The tablet has a lot features such as an IR. Most won't use it, but I find it handy to control my tv. Here are a few things that I like the most.1. The Screen resolution is amazing2. Browser works flawlessly. I travel a lot and I have had no wifi issues anywhere I have used the tablet.3. Tablet is smooth and fast4. Pen is very Comfortable and writes smooth with a Zagg HD Screen Protector5. I never run out of RAM and I have not had any issues with the tablet running slow.6. No issues with Bluetooth or WIFI7. With the Micro SD slot, I have lots of Storage.Things I dislike1. Built in video Player skips when watching movies2. Samsung did not include the shortcut features that the Note 2 has3. The auto brightness works great if outside, but when there little to no light the Screen is to dim. I find myself making manual adjustments4. Battery life is not as good as Some tablets this Size. Though with the note 2, using the Pen drains the battery more with use. This could be the same with the tablet.Overall,Ian happy with the tablet. $600 is a bit Steep, but the pen features are what I like the most. So far I have hot had any issues,

Reviews.Title: Amazing Tablet
Reviews.Author: ajn1963
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my aged Toshiba Thrive Tablet.  This table it incredible.Sound is beautiful.  Video is sharp.  The S-PEN and writing and speaking features are incredible.  That Toshiba Thrive was like a stone tablet compared to this device.  I actually do not type out text messages or email anymore, I write them with the S-PEN, and even speaking, the speech to text works amazingly well.  Just used to hand interaction to send messages.I can't find anything bad to say about this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Diane T.
Reviews.Content: This was my first tablet and I love it, of course I don't have anything to compare it with.  The display is gorgeous, like using the S-pen and like having the option of adding more memory.  The apps offered are all I need and they have a lot of apps in the App store.  Would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: My first Tablet and am Very Happy.
Reviews.Author: fedexbicman
Reviews.Content: I considered a lot of variables before buying the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32GB, Black)After weighing out cost, processing speed, operating system, storage space and expandability I chose this product.It's screen size makes it easy to see and read.  The clarity of the screen is superb and the Hi Definition images are crisp and sharp.  I was hoping I could use one of my favorite programs on the tablet but, unfortunately there isn't an app for it yet.  However, there is a suitable substitute app that I am using and learning to like.  It is Sketchbook Pro.  Learning it is not hard and getting used to the brushes has been fairly easy.  I am used to Corel, Painter Lite.  I love the mixing and blending abilities that this program has and I will always be watching for the release of an Android based App for it.I would recommend this Tablet to anyone considering and Android based product.

Reviews.Title: I Love The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014!
Reviews.Author: Patti A. Godwin "cricket"
Reviews.Content: I Love The Samsung Galaxy Note!I Love All The Features!It Takes The Best Pictures!I Love To Take It With Me Wherever I Go! I Love How Easy It Is To Operate!

Reviews.Title: Works better for me than the Ipad.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Carter
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet.  I own both this and Ipad air. The Samsung meets my needs with the S-pen.  I use it a lot.  The speed is great. Sure there are a couple of specialty apps on the Ipad I can't get on android, but majority of them, I can. Also, I use the Samsung galaxy s4 phone, so they match up better.  And it seems to work with  chromecast better than Ipad. The Ipad keeps dropping connection to it, but not the samsung.  If you are really in to making hand written notes or drawing, then the note is for you.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: salogub, roxanne
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a Christmas and the giftee is loving it.  User friendly, easy.  Learn something new everyday.  Great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Much better buy than Ipad
Reviews.Author: Jason Tu "Dog Photo Man"
Reviews.Content: I own  Ipad, Asus Transformer and Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition (bought not from Amazon). It is fast and has a beautiful display and the battery lasts > 10 hours. I bought Note 10.1 for reasons: 1) price 2) Android software selection 3) more files/format support.  4) the sound quality. I really can not fault anything on this tablet. The boot time is fast, 64db sd card and great camera/pictures. I just wish that it can be larger up to the laptop size say greater than 15 inch. Yes, make it lighter and thinner so I can carry it anywhere. If I have only one tablet to buy, I will go for Note for the return of my money. Ipad is too expensive and Apple has too many restrictions on everything. The built quality is also great. The offer Samsung is giving is also attractive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet-Worth The Price
Reviews.Author: Disabled Veteran
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet 3 weeks, and am very satisfied with my purchase, not to mention receiving it tax free!  Now, my wife also wants one, which I will purchase for her. The tablet exceeded my expectations in every relm!  I spent a month researching two other tablets, by Toshiba and Apple, the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 won hands down!  Even at the current price, I would highly recommend this tablet for serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  Only complaint was the lack of a manual but I was able to find it online finally.  Learn new things every day.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Machine
Reviews.Author: A. Wal "TW"
Reviews.Content: Received mine yesterday morning and started playing with it when I got home from work.  What started off as a quick poking around to get the know the machine turned into me sitting in my recliner until 2am enjoying my new toy.  The Android interface is smooth as silk as always and Samsung has no shortage of features packed into the hardware itself.  I have an iPad through my company, and all I can say is that Apple better do something quickly to catch up, because Samsung is miles ahead of them right now.

Reviews.Title: Easly one of the best gadgets I now own
Reviews.Author: Adam Thomas
Reviews.Content: The 10.1 note is just amazing. I am currently a student and i wanted to purchase a tablet because i was tiered of carring around my books for my various classes. I was looking around and I saw this one. The thing that sold me on this was the fact that I can use it just like a note book and take physical notes on the tablet its self, its a really cool feature. I was skeptical on how the writing would look, but it looks like writing you would write on a piece of paper, its that accurate on the detail of it. Now I happly use it in class to take notes and pull up my pdf files of books the professor asks us to look at.Its a great buy for students such as myself. Its lightning fast if you need to use the interent, the camera takes amazingly high detailed pictures, the note taking feature is so useful, and its really compact. You cant go wrong with it!

Reviews.Title: 4 stars as everything in life always has room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: Pauline Joshua
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this product. It is customizable, sleek/stylish, easy to use, and does everything i wanted it to do. I also like the fact that word doc, xl files, ppt, etc can be viewed and edited on this tablet. Recently I purchased a car and it was awesome to have the xl file of all the offers with me as i went from dealership to dealership. The only thing i didn't like abt this is the fact that it can be quite difficult to edit these files. But it does do it but just a bit slower than a computer.One thing I don't like about the tablet is the fact that the charging port is at the bottom and it is nearly impossible to charge and use it at the same time. The way I bypassed this problem is by taking my tablet out of the case and putting it back in upside down so the charge port is on the top. With screen rotation on, the tablet automatically adjusts. But this is is SUCH a hassle to do it every time I want to charge and use at the same time, which is pretty frequent. Like I said... there is always room for improvement.I will update this review as I use it more.As far as recommendations... I would 100% recommend this product to others. In fact I am already doing so, and no, I do not work of Samsung or get paid for this.

Reviews.Title: For the wife
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I really have never used this yet since I can't get the wife and son off of it. So that must mean it great and work fine with plenty of speed. Happy wife happy life!

Reviews.Title: A great improvement over Note 10.1 2012 Edition
Reviews.Author: Discerning Buyer
Reviews.Content: I love my old Note 10.1. In fact, if I had not been passing it along to my other half when they decided they wanted one, I would have kept that for a good long time. The new 2014 edition is great especially in the screen. It is beautiful. It is as beautiful as the Note 3 screen which I have as well. It is faster than the old Note 10.1. How much so from a noticeability perspective? For my stuff... not dramatically noticeable (to me). If your use cases are different than mine then you will probably notice a huge difference but most of my work on it is not too demanding. It is more about comfort and relaxation for me than a workhorse. Any time I have needed it to come to bat with power, it was not sluggish or cumbersome in any way and I feel like it would meet most if not all workhorse demands that could be thrown at it. There are a lot of improvements beyond the screen. Many aesthetic. The lack of onscreen menu and back buttons is a little tricky to get used to after having them before. It is a trade off, screen real estate used for content vs navigation being right in front of you at all times. A lot of new integrations and application improvements come with it as well. The build is of great quality and It feels very solid. I had a case for my old Note 10.1 and I would say it is required for the 2014 version. I could not imagine using this in any serious manner without a case. It is just too slippery to prop up somewhere, on something etc. To hold it, not very slippy but to lean it against something? Forget it... get a case. I can tell you this as well. All in all however a great purchase and would not hesitate.

Reviews.Title: Powerfull, stable, everything you could need.
Reviews.Author: Marco Illescas
Reviews.Content: Surely there will be something better tomorrow and maybe other OS users have a different opinion, it is an instinctive reaction when leadership is challenged. But I have 20 years of working in IT and I find that this device is able to do whatever you need in real life. The Google play strore have some limitations in terms of professional and entertainment applications, mainly by access restrictions to regional and monopolized markets, but not for long.

Reviews.Title: Just okay, not as fast, stable, or robust as I hoped
Reviews.Author: Drew Jemilo
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy the 10.1 to replace my aging iPad 2.  I just bought a Nexus 5 phone and LOVE the new Android Kit Kat OS.  Even though the device didn't have Kit Kat, I thought Samsung would make up for this with the updated "2014 Edition."  What primarily drew me was the handwriting functionality.  It's cool, but I found more cons than pros:PROS:- Handwriting capabilities:  Much better than the iPad and its third party stylus and apps- Widgets:  I love them.- The textured back: It makes it easy to hold without a case.CONS:- Stability: Expect to periodically reboot.- Speed:  Jerky motion, both with the Android interface as well as apps that are speedy on my iPad 2- Battery life:  I guess I'm spoiled by my iPad 2 and Nexus 5 phone- Fewer applications:  There is NO Amazon Instant Video app.  Wow, a BIG downer since I use it a lot.  A few other favorites aren't there either.- Handwriting integration with Evernote:  I hoped to integrate my handwritten notes with my other notes in Evernote.  They transferred over in hard-to-read image blocks.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet for Those Wanting Productivity
Reviews.Author: L. Orth
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet that a lot of the reviewers (as in professional reviews like cnet) don't cover very well. Most tablets are made mostly for consumption, but this tablet has a lot of productivity tools built right into it with most being based around the use of the S-pen, which is incredibly powerful. For my uses, this tablet can do enough to replace having to carry a laptop.S- PenFirst, the tablet can recognize script or print writing, and does a great job even with my terrible handwriting.  Samsung really did a good job with the recognition software. The pen also has rubber tip which provides a little drag on the screen in an attempt to simulate writing on paper. It's better than just a plastic tip, but doesn't reproduce the feel of a real pen on paper.I was actually somewhat concerned because prior to my purchase I tested one of these tablets in the store and the S-Pen was pretty worn down and dragged a lot. I was glad to see in the box that Samsung gives you 6 new tips for your pen. I do not know how long each tip will last since I have not needed to replace one yet. Also, if the tablet is sleeping when you remove the pen, then it will awaken and unlock for you.Air command, which is launched with the button on the S-Pen, is very useful and makes certain task more efficient. The Action Memo accessed through air command has become my favorite tool. I now start almost all Google Internet and Map searches from it. Of course, Action Memo also does other things such as allow you to jot down a quick note, add a task, start an email, or add to your contacts. One benefit of the Action Memo is that it opens in a small window over whatever you are looking at. Why is this good? Because if you are looking up or writing something from the document you are currently working on, such as a phone number, email, or address, then you can see the information as you write it in the Action Memo. Then it is just a quick click to map it or save to your contacts.The tablet also has an Active Digitizer, which is the system that tracks the S-Pen. With this system, when you are writing with the S-Pen, the tablet will reject any touches from your hand so you can rest your hand on the tablet while writing. It also allows the S-Pen to be pressure sensitive.Writing on the device is also good for meetings. I previously used my phone combine with MS OneNote in meetings to take notes, but people gave me looks like I was ignoring them and texting. Writing on a tablet looks more like what people are use to seeing in a meeting; people writing notes with a pen.Handwriting is faster than the on-screen keyboard in certain situations, and it is especially nice when you need to write out equations. S-Note can transform drawn equations into text and symbols. Handwriting also helps me remember and learn quicker, but I also like having a typed document for future reference. With this tablet I can hand write and produced text documents at the same timeNow, I have encountered a few issues with the hand witting recognition. It will sometimes incorrectly capitalize words and seems to do so really randomly. It will also put commas instead of periods if they are anything more than a dot. Capital I's are also sometimes interpreted as a 1 or a slash (/). Characters like 1 and I require you to add the additional lines so it is recognized correctly. Sometimes G will come up as an 6.On-Screen KeyboardThe tablet also comes with Swiftkey software installed, which works like Swype but also has predictive text (tries to guess what you will type next in a bar above the keyboard where you can just hit the next word). For typing, it is accurate and I have found it can be really fast. The predictive text is somewhat creepy how it can guess the next word you want. I have been able to type entire sentences just by hitting the words out of the predicted list.The tablet will try to correct words though, even in handwriting mode. I can be kind of annoying when you type out an obscure word and it keeps correcting it to what it thinks you meant.SoftwareTouchWiz, Samsung's front end for android, is good on this tablet, especially with the S-Pen integration. If you like your Samsung S3 or S4, then this tablet will feel right at home. I have not encountered lag to complain about and all the Apps I run operate smoothly. If you compare a pure Android tablet with TouchWiz, then you can see the "lag" when swiping between screens, but we are talking milliseconds here in difference.I also like the ability to turn on and off certain settings from the top pull down such as Wifi, GPS, and screen rotate. In addition, with the case I put on my tablet, when I open the cover it will unlock the tablet and open up a screen with your calendar and a drawing area that functions like the Action Memo. It's a really convenient feature to have that Action Memo immediately available.S-Note is pretty good, especially for handwriting and writing equations, but the tablet also comes with Polaris office which allows you to edit or create Word, Excel, and PowerPoint documents. Since discovering Polaris, I have mainly been using it over S-Note. I haven't found a way to save files straight from Polaris to Sky drive so I use the Sky drive App, which works pretty well. I am looking into other options as well such as Google Drive and Evernote. Samsung also has Dropbox and gives you 50 Gb's of storage for 2 years when you purchase the tablet. I have not signed up for it so I cannot tell you about that process or how well it works.If you like to draw, then the tablet also comes with Sketchbook. I played with it some and the pressure sensitivity on the pen works really well. I am not much of an artist so I cannot comment on this program too much, but there is a wide selection of brushes and large amount of settings to fine-tune everything.Battery and ScreenI am getting good battery life out of the tablet. With Wifi connected and working on word documents, email, and internet, I can get an entire day out of the tablet. Currently, I have about ~5 hours of use on the tablet with screen brightness on Auto and Power Save off. The tablet is sitting at 52% battery.The big screen is also a reason I purchased this tablet. The larger screen gives you more area to work and makes the multi window functions actually worth using, especially the S-PEN air commands. I also have a phone (not a Samsung) with a large screen, so a smaller tablet did not feel like much of an upgrade over just using my phone.Other NegativesPrice - If you do not want the S-Pen or Productivity tools, then you can consider a cheaper tablet. Depending on what you need to do on a computer, it is not a full replacement for a full laptop, but that has more to do with the current Apps that are available, as well as how much more efficient a keyboard and mouse is (though you can use a keyboard and mouse on this tablet).Location of Home, Menu, and back button - The location can be annoying, but I will rotate the tablet so they are at the top of the screen.Speakers - While better than rear facing speakers, they do stick out the side. I feel I have to have the sound up much louder than required since they are on the sides instead of facing directly toward you on the front.Camera - You phone probably has a camera and taking pictures with a tablet is awkward, but it is there if you need it. I think of it more as a utility feature than anything else.Overall, I think it is one of the best tablets on the market right now for productivity. Since having a tablet that could function as a useful tool for me is important, I put most of my effort into finding a tablet that gave me those options. I would definitely repeat this purchase.

Reviews.Title: great tablet, but bluetooth doesn't work correctly.
Reviews.Author: Hannah MacLean "Hannah Happy Feet"
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet now since October 2013 (2.5 months) and I love this tablet. I use it frequently. However, my two biggest problems with it are 1) bluetooth doesn't work well at all on this tablet and 2) it comes pre-loaded with a lot of things I don't use, and that is built into the price. These are the reasons why I have taken two stars off the five. I have played with the bluetooth to try to make it work, and I have made sure that things that use bluetooth (i.e. keyboards) work with other devices... it is only this tablet which cannot use them. The problem seems to be that the bluetooth will be okay for all of thirty seconds when I turn it on, but then it stops working. To have to reset it every thirty seconds (if it works, because it often doesn't even do that) is aggravating to say the least. I am most disappointed in this feature because I had planned on using the 10.1 2014 with an external keyboard, and I can't.Otherwise, I find this tablet is lovely. It is my first tablet. I love the multitask function and use it relatively frequently. My primary use for the tablet has been for video chatting, as my fiancee and I live in two different states. I can use google video chat with other windows thanks to the multitask feature. Thanks to the new skype floating window feature on android tablets, I can also use Skype while doing other things on my tablet. The screen is beautiful; I use it any time I am looking throuh a large amount of photos because the picture quality is so high. I read some reviews complaining about battery life but I have to say I haven't had a problem. If the screen brightness is turned down, the tablet lasts for days (with moderate use) or for 3-6 hours while video chatting (if fully charged to begin with). The only time I've had a problem with the battery was when the brightness was turned all the way up while I was video chatting: this caused it to discharge while it was plugged in. However, when the brightness is turned down, it charges just fine while video chatting, albeit slower than normal.As a tablet, it's great, but I am quite irritated with the bluetooth problem, and I would have happily bought a cheaper, non pre loaded tablet over one with all the extras. I have a laptop that I use for word processing, photo-editing, and times when I want to have a lot of internet tabs open (happens a lot when planning a wedding!), but overall, this tablet has been and continues to be a great tablet. When I am without my laptop, this tablet is perfectly able to surf the web (and I can use stuff like the Pinterest app to keep track of things). It's definitely a powerhouse. I do wish though that SNote would allow me to create folders to organize my notes... hopefully some future update will include that feature. But, in the meantime, I am satisfied with this tablet, though I am stuck with the on screen touch keyboard, which is not my favorite.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Adam Shrader
Reviews.Content: I have completely fallen in love with this tablet. The microSD card slot is what sold it for me when I was comparing tablets but the screen resolution and color is incredible.  I would definitely recommend this to someone looking for a tablet/mini-laptop. I bought a wireless Bluetooth keyboard and it is a perfectly capable laptop for lite tasks (e-mail/some word processing/browsing).

Reviews.Title: Convenient, useful, portable, does what I bought it for. Love the stylus.
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: After much waffling, I bought this tablet with a handful of specific purposes in mind. First and foremost, I am a musician and wanted a tablet to read music on. While I'd really prefer a larger screen in a perfect world, what sold me on this one instead of one of the (relatively few) significantly larger ones was the stylus. I need to be able to make annotations in my music the way I would with a pencil. Zooming in and then writing with my finger doesn't cut it when I want to be able to write in small markings like accidentals, breath marks, cues, etc, in the middle of a rehearsal. Unfortunately there aren't nearly as many music score apps for Android as there are for iOS, and they don't necessarily all take as much advantage of the stylus as I wish they did, but there there are some and I found what I needed. And there are more Android apps all the time.But regardless, the stylus makes a big difference and I think it makes this device a very competitive alternative to an iPad, even though more musicians seem to use iPads.Incidentally, the actual surface area of the screen is about the same on the Note 10.1 as on the full-sized iPad. I actually prefer the iPad's aspect ratio, but that's not such a big deal.In terms of reading music off of it, I still wish the screen was a bit bigger since I have to stand far enough away to not bang my instrument into the stand. But at the same time, I think it's easier to read smaller-sized notes off this screen than it is off of paper at the same size, and at least lighting isn't an issue.Second, I wanted something that could be a lighter, more compact alternative to carrying around my laptop, but something big enough to be reasonably comfortable for general internet use and getting actual work done without being frustrated about not being able to see enough of it at once. For that, it's perfect. The stylus makes even just web browsing easier because it's easier to click on small links than by poking with my finger. And being able to write in the text instead of typing on the "imaginary" keyboard on the screen is really great. I only wish you could do it any time there is a text box, instead of only in some cases, in some apps, or on some websites.Samsung did go to a certain amount of trouble to add stuff that the stylus is good for, some of which is useful, but even aside from that, to me the stylus just generally enhances the ease of use by more than I expected.Other odds and ends: the display looks really nice. The camera is good enough that I can take a photo of my music and comfortably read it off of that if I don't have time to scan it. People talk about the molded-fake-leather-texture back feeling cheap, but it feels fine to me. I don't really care about that; I put it in a case and don't really see the back much anyway. It's sort of annoying that the port for the charger is right at the bottom, which makes it awkward to use while it's plugged in.But on the other hand, that hasn't been an issue much because the battery life is quite good.So all in all, I've been very happy with it. So far, I'm satisfied with my choice of a device with a stylus over a device with a bigger screen.But hey Samsung! A Galaxy Note with a screen the size AND aspect ratio of a regular piece of letter-sized paper (or even just reasonably close) would be AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Albert
Reviews.Content: Very awesome tablet but if you dent think you will utilize the S pen than you Can probably get another Samsung tablet

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Cody Moorhead
Reviews.Content: This tablet is nothing short of great. I have only had it for a day or so at the time of writing this so I will post a more I depth review later on. So far so good the only "negative" I have found is that I wish the camera was a little better but let's be honest how often are we taking pictures with our tablets?

Reviews.Title: The Wife loves it!
Reviews.Author: Daryl Victoriano "Seth Victor"
Reviews.Content: It's thin and feels great on the hands, it's also very responsive (unlike past Android products), and highly customizable. The Octo-Core CPU and 3GB's of RAM makes these one of, if not the most, powerful tablet on the market. Unfortunately, it's really expensive so it's hard to give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Dena Sarauw
Reviews.Content: Great product I just wished there were more company making full screen apps for it.  I find myself already using this more then my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet - Better than any iPad
Reviews.Author: C. Bireley
Reviews.Content: Hands down best Android tablet on the market. I have used several now, and nothing feels so zippy, and is as delightfully compact as the Note. I recommend it over everything. Yeah, it is more expensive, but the software capabilities of the native stylus are amazing.

Reviews.Title: Better than the i-pad i bought for my wife
Reviews.Author: tim hislop
Reviews.Content: Great and fast, works great. Does so many apps for android. Clear color, battery lasts longer than my android phone too.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely awesome tablet! Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Gelinas
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet! I also have an iPad Mini and there's no comparison when it comes to flexibility and functionality. I absolutely love the features and open source access to applications and development.

Reviews.Title: Great for Work and Fun
Reviews.Author: Dria
Reviews.Content: It's been so easy to adapt to this - works just like the phone. So much faster than any iPad I've experienced. I love the Android system, and the Office tools are compatible with my work programs.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: nacobe
Reviews.Content: This is my new baby!!!  I love that I can have my phone (also a Samsung Galaxy), TV, and tablet interact with one another.  The resolution is WONDERFUL!!!!

Reviews.Title: Early delivery
Reviews.Author: Atis K. Palmer "kin3"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this tablet this week and it arrived one day earlier than the projected delivery date. So far me and my wife just love it. I will update this after we have used it for awhile.

Reviews.Title: Another great Samsung product
Reviews.Author: Jeff Hoot
Reviews.Content: We have only performed the initial set up and test run because this was purchased as a Christmas gift but everything seems to work just like my Samsung Galaxy S4 phone.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Tablet!
Reviews.Author: P. K. Sage
Reviews.Content: Delivers more capability then I can understand or fathom. Incredible Tablet for which I am using to share my portraits as I take them with an Eye Fi Mobi 8GB SD Card in my Canon T3i, colors are fantastic and details are sharper then 1080 Full HD TV. WiFi transfer at 28mbps from Camera to Tablet memory Micro SD Card. I wish I had more time to play...

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet love it
Reviews.Author: chrisbm
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and Iwas a little hesitant that it would be too difficult to learn but I am finding it not that hard at all. It is a nice size also.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Brower
Reviews.Content: its perfect for what we need it for and I just love it! Tottaly glad i went with this one!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet
Reviews.Author: Kimaloo
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, I love this tablet! I mostly use mine for games, drawing, streaming Netflix, and surfing the internet. The S-pen is very comfortable and has a natural flow for me... I find it easier to use for drawing than my bamboo tablet for instance. As far as battery life goes, I have no complaints. The first day I had it, I literally played around with it from about 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening and only went down to 22% battery without being plugged in at all. I played games, drew stuff, downloaded a ton apps, and even watched a few of episodes of my fave shows. The screen is beautifully crisp and clear but audio is a little hollow. I usually use headphones though so it's a non-issue for me. I haven't had any connectivity issues with my wifi (802.11ac) and it's just as fast as my hard wired desktop. The weight is evenly balanced and not cumbersome at all. I also really like the leather look back... it's easier to grip than the super smooth plastics on most tablets/phones.If you're on the fence about it, I really think the big difference between this and other similar tablets available right now is the S-pen which is great for casual artists, writing, and more precise navigation. If you buy one, I would recommend watching some tutorials and reviews online just to see all the little features and tricks to get the most out of your 10.1. Overall, I highly recommend it and feel it's worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: As awesome as you think it would be, a true power house.
Reviews.Author: nexgen91
Reviews.Content: I am loving the Note 10.1 2014 it beats my old TF700 into the dirt, the multi tasking capabilities of this tablet are amazing. I have ran some very graphics intensive games and it handled them without a hiccup. I am truly impressed with this tablets capabilities. The S Pen and interface is amazing, only thing I wish was there was more pen window apps than there are but I have found a work around to load documents and such in pen window, here are the directions: open a browser window and search for pdf/docx etc file type that you want to open, find a file on google search results and click it, you will be presented with the open with dialog, now you can select the app to open and it will open in the pen window, from here you can open any document that you want and it will be in the pen window. If I run into any issues with the tablet I will update my review, but as of now I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Way better than iPad Air
Reviews.Author: neod
Reviews.Content: I was in need for a all-around tablet PC for our living room. We wanted to be able to check some of our emails or webpages from a handy device without necesarly using our laptop. I first purchased the iPad because it is all I ever had when it comes to a tablet. But I read the multi-user feature of the Note 10.1 2014 and I imediately exchange my ipad Air for a Note 10.1 2014 edition. and omg, the devide is the same size/weight as the ipad air, as well crafted. and the Multiuser allows me to provide the device to guest at our home even if I have my personal app (facebook and of course amazon app). My guest can't have access to my apps!Love it !

Reviews.Title: Great tablet fun with S pen!
Reviews.Author: Bruck
Reviews.Content: Awesome screen.  S pen function is very nice!  The office apps are nice but not quite as good as having Microsoft office stuff.  I had trouble opening Excel with their version. you can  download something from the android market for this though.  Nice build feels solid in your hands.Cons - battery life could be better,  still waiting on the free stuff that you get with it 4 weeks in takes forever

Reviews.Title: A fantastic tablet.
Reviews.Author: Nathan Duval
Reviews.Content: This item, works well, very similar to my cellphone, so there is no learning curve. The screen is high definition,  crystal clear. The battery life is good, lasting most of the day even when being used by several applications at once.With the Samsung Notes app, and the more powerful word processing applications, this is very easy to create emails and all types of correspondence.The camera that's included takes fantastic photos.  I am using this Note 10.1 in replacement of my Nook Color.  Now I can have my Nook books, my Kindle books, and my Audible books all in one place.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for what it is
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Over the last few months I have been on the search for a tablet. I had never found them to be worth the money that they cost and the few I have tried just didn't do "it" for me.I originally bought this tablet and actually enjoyed it. I was convinced to return it and try a "Surface Pro 2" Long story short. I hated it, it made doing simple things more complicated that they needed to be. I ultimately returned it and purchased this tablet, again.Pros:It's fast.S Pen is "neat".I can do all the things I do regularly on my phone and more.Multi WindowMulti User accounts (suck it ipad)expandable memoryDecent Battery lifeCons:ExpensiveCharge port is on the "bottom" (wtf design)Overall it's great. Would be 5 Stars if charge port was on side

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Benita
Reviews.Content: .when my husband got my tablet. I just couldn't believe my eyes. There's so much u can do. My son is in the Army. Now I can write to him and see him .  Thank God for tablets like this.

Reviews.Title: Apple Killer..
Reviews.Author: Chaplain M.
Reviews.Content: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32GB, White)This is a great tablet it is a apple killer the things you can do plus apple dose not have 3gb of Ram

Reviews.Title: Wow Impressive Tablet.
Reviews.Author: Martin J. Rademakers
Reviews.Content: Have used the Samsung galaxy note 10.1 2014 edition for 3 weeks now. It does everything I want with high performance and mobility for a large device. Fantastic graphics. This first Samsung I purchased. Now replacing the iPads for everyone in the family. Impressive Tablet.

Reviews.Title: great tablet + much better then the iPad air
Reviews.Author: Tamaiev "isreal"
Reviews.Content: great tablet + much better then the iPad airYou can do with this tablet anything you want much better than the iPad air, you can download videos from Amy website on the Samsung tablet like a pc, but on the iPad air you cannot, and also the resolution is much better than the iPad air, and it's feels much faster for me, and a lot of features on it, I am highly recommended to anyone that really want to enjoy his tablet.

Reviews.Title: move over nexus 7 now theres something meatier
Reviews.Author: standroid6971
Reviews.Content: At first I was 100%  sold on the 2013 nexus 7 until I actually got to play with it at best buy . The nexus7 (N7)was a complete let down . The same hd video on the N7 1920X1200 screen was even thrumped by even the galaxy note 8.0 sitting beside it even though the note 8.0 is only 1280X800 . Then I saw the new 2014 note 10.1 and man was I blown away . The screen is just a thing of beauty at 2560X1600 . I watch alot of movie on my note2 during breaks breaks at work and the N10.1 didnt disappoint . Im a total Samsung devotee since getn my note2 a while back . So when I saw the note 10.1 I knew that was the tablet for me . Haven't gotn it yet but will update this when ive had the chance to really see what this beast can do . Until then peace my ninjas

Reviews.Title: excelent product
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Bustos
Reviews.Content: I been using Android tableto since 3.0 iconia a500 acer and the devices of this kind are excelent for listen music, reading, viewing documents, watching videos, but they are bad for capture documents or notes from a meeting  but with the s-pen, taking notes from a meeting become really easy and natural, I love this tablet

Reviews.Title: Happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Winters Dance "Winters Dance"
Reviews.Content: I use this tablet everyday and have no issues with it. The speed compared to the previous Galaxy Note 10.1 Tablet (2 yrs ago) I owned is much faster and higher screen resolution.Some of my uses are as a extra remote for my GoPro camera, reviewing business documents, and heavy skype user with clients and family. I added the extra 64GB memory to really expand the storage capabilities and can store videos and pictures that are edited using the tablet in the field and then uploaded to either online storage or sent directly to clients when I get wifi access.The micro USB allows me to easily connect the tablet to my computer for easy file transfer and also using a USB adapter, I can plug in any USB stick to view and modify contents.Overall, this is my portable office/business and I am really happy with it. Being able to take, edit, and send pictures & videos to clients or easily connect it to modern TVs wirelessly to display my works (looks impressive to clients) has been a good use of this tablet for me.

Reviews.Title: It does more that I can figure out
Reviews.Author: Patricia J. Moore "Plain thing"
Reviews.Content: Sets up quickly and easy to use. Use it more than the main computer in the house now due to the wireless feature.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Likeitis
Reviews.Content: Impressed is a good word for the Note 10.1.  Basically all the functions work as expected and the android operating system is very fast.  The email function takes a second or less to flash across the screen, for example, which other OSes take longer. The connection of the Note to a PC is a snap, and it syns up to "Outlook" nicely.  The bluetooth works nicely with such things as speakers and other bluetooth items. The apps are endless.  BUT, BUT, the one feature that makes this tablet outstanding is the S pen and its functions.  I take notes with it, make "to do lists",  and cut out text or images that are needed for research, etc.  Take a look at the demos on "You Tube" for videos on "S note".  The other feature I use a lot are the voice commands that one uses to look up items on the web or to list items in my calendar.  The Note is so efficient that I use it much more than anticipated. This tablet is one useful tool.  The one item that does not work well for me is "smart eyes", and that may be caused by the fact  that I wear glasses with progessive lenses.  Overall the note is an intregral part of my life, and easy to carry around and use throughout the day.  I'm impressed!

Reviews.Title: Very well built and worth paying for the memory increase
Reviews.Author: Treekatt
Reviews.Content: The tablet is built well and, while heavier than the ASUS Transformer 701 I had, I have been able to use it without fear of it breaking apart or failing. The 64Gb SD is able to store all the apps I need plus hold videos and music. Speed is there and the image is great. I have not tried the camera as I am not big on that but I have occasion to do video conferencing and testing it out shows that there is no problem with the visuals.I picked up my unit as a manufacturer refurbishment with a 90 day manufacturer warranty. I bought the Square Trade to cover the price of purchase. Since there are times where production line systems have problems with high return rates I figure this was a great way to purchase the 32Gb version at 100$ less without giving anything up.

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: M. Smith
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. I don't have any complaints, but something weird is happening.Con:I'm getting a dead spot when I'm trying to write or draw something. I think it's a problem with either the tablet or the kind of case you want to use to protect the tablet. It could be both. I'm guessing it has to do with how magnets work. Perhaps magnetism is affecting the screen which prevents it from detecting the s pen in that particular area.Pros:It's fast. The screen is beautiful when you're watching things. Everything runs smooth. There's lots of space for photos, movies, and etc. Being able to write notes on the screen when you're reading something and can take a screen shot is an awesome feature. Connecting to the Internet is easy and then it can save the password so it's automatic in the future. The battery life is decent. I don't have to charge for days depending what I'm doing. Also, with all the stuff that can be stored on the cloud, you don't really even have to use up all the space that's on the tablet.In one word, this tablet is, "Smooth!"

Reviews.Title: wonderful in every way!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My son won a $500 gift toward any electronics. His first choice was an iPad. We had it for 2 weeks. After spending days trying to get the thing to talk to our computers and printers, we took it back. Then we ordered the Galaxy. It has been a dream. It talks easily to our printer and computers. The screen is lovely!

Reviews.Title: Great  and better after upgrade to kitkat
Reviews.Author: Norman Miller
Reviews.Content: Great device if you need big. Would consider 8 inch next time. 10.1 is big for use in airplane for navigation charts. Upgraded os to android 4.4 then rooted and removed some bloatware to make it better.

Reviews.Title: Love this Tablet
Reviews.Author: Kelly Stum
Reviews.Content: I started out with the Note 8.0 and graduated to this for a larger screen.  I'm a former iPad fan so that's what I'll compare it to - this item is much lighter than my iPad (2nd Gen, full size) and has a beautiful display that is crystal clear and sharp.  I play a couple of games (Hay Day and Candy Crush) and everything works smoothly in the games, including the display.  This tablet seems to be super fast compared to my 8.0 version and I wouldn't take anything for it!

Reviews.Title: The World in my Hand
Reviews.Author: James Cross "Booking it, one word at a time."
Reviews.Content: I have several Samsung products. The latest Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 gives me a the fast action and fact connection that I needed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent piece of art
Reviews.Author: konoro
Reviews.Content: I got the refurbished one. I did not get much of the extra services (google credit, etc) but that is not a big issue. DealStop did a good job in delivering the product at a low price. It even came with a screen protector!This is a great product. I love the light weight. The productivity I get with this is supreme. I can even use my favorite mangas as a layer in Sketchbook to learn how to draw them using the S-pen. It makes drawing super simple (I only draw as a hobby). Taking notes with the pen is also seamless and I love it. The screen is brilliant too. Once you get used to the pen, I don't think you can go back to using just fingers. It's so convenient. The battery life is excellent too. I can easily use it for a whole day. Netflix is gorgeous with it.People say it lags sometimes, and it does, but personally that is negligible and is not causing much trouble.  It would be better if I can get Microsoft Word and such, but the other alternatives would do. The fact that I can use my micro SDs is super too. I use a 32GB sony microSD for my music and such. The look may be slightly cheaper than the iPad, but it is decent.

Reviews.Title: A fantastic buy
Reviews.Author: ann
Reviews.Content: the samsung galaxy note 10.1 is a must have for the professional. light weight and extremely sleek, it leaves your colleagues wanting to emulate your efficiency. you can and would take it everywhere with you. i love it.

Reviews.Title: my Samsung tablet
Reviews.Author: kimberly davis
Reviews.Content: I had to send the 1st one back, because it would not power up.  The 2nd one I've had to take to best buy to show me how to restart it, because it would not power up after that it has worked fine.  I love my Samsung galaxy tablet I hope it continue to work.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase.
Reviews.Author: Pauleni
Reviews.Content: Combined with the optional keyboard and leather case, it makes for a perfect traveling companion.  Bigger than a Samsung phone and smaller than a full sized computer it shows me all files, emails, etc.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: BILL
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Great graphics & memory.  Excellent tutorials, instructions.  Really love it!  Another great Samsung product as they always do!

Reviews.Title: My first tablet
Reviews.Author: Snake Eyes
Reviews.Content: I bought this without knowing full well what I would end up using it for.  Truthfully, I am still figuring that out.-I started taking notes with it at work, and after getting used to the little stylus, I can take pretty good notes with it.-I like using the multiple-app feature.  I use it in meetings and when conversing with friends online.-For everything else(internet, social media, etc) It works well.  I don't have a ton of large apps.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Samuel
Reviews.Content: Great tablet much better than ipad you won't be disappointed with this tablet battery life is pretty good as well

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Andrius
Reviews.Content: Works perfect ! Samsung moved very far with technology. Really like this i item would suggest for everyone to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (16GB,... ....OUTSTANDING PRODUCT  !!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Cosmin Toma
Reviews.Content: Today I got  this product witch is amazing !!!! exactly like they present the tablet in their tutorials. For my wife this tablet is a piece of jewelry. She is really happy in did. The details are so  good , the display is like a mirror ,the tasks are processed  quite fast . As soon as I  open the box  I was so curios if is reading the  jump drive and I was surprised how fast recognize it. WI FI is great , So people ,I can tell you great vendor ,original  sealed product  excellent packed, the stylus pen is great  .... my wife is very happy and we all know...this is a big deal in the house. :)  I can not tell you anything about the battery life yet. But I am sure that SAMSUNG dos not make cheap compromises.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition
Reviews.Author: RICHARD  TREMBLEY
Reviews.Content: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition is awesome as expected.  There was a delivery problem with the first one I ordered but Amazon shipped a replacement in time for my wife's birthday.

Reviews.Title: Like it but not in love with it.
Reviews.Author: Dave Freese
Reviews.Content: I chose the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 over the newer Pro version simply for the price difference based on memory. I am using this as a Laptop replacement and although I would not consider myself a techy expert, I do know my way around computers. That being said it was a leap for me to walk away from the "predictability" of a windows based product and into an oversized smart phone. Sorry iPad lovers, I'm an Apple hater. ;-)  Any real problems I have are related to the transition from one to the other, ie software and apps. Battery life is more than adequate for me. I like not having to worry about plugging it in every 2-4 hours. Might be different if watching movies or other memory intensive apps like YouTube. I like the SPen and note taking ability. External SD card slot will come in handy. I gave it 4 stars because I would have like more detailed tutorials for the Samsung apps Sketch Book, S Note, etc. Using YouTube for that info is not giving me my moneys worth and Samsung Hub has not been adequate. Or maybe I just haven't played with them enough. Also I am not yet convinced that a Windows tablet might have been a better fit.

Reviews.Title: Much improved over older tablets
Reviews.Author: Tennesseeuser
Reviews.Content: The processor is much better than the Toshiba I used to use.  It also can display more than one page at a time, which is a nice feature.  It has the annoying property of most tablets (thanks Apple) that there are apps you cannot get rid of, and even when you turn them off, you get a warning (probably not true) that turning this off might impact other apps you are using.  My guess is that it limits the amount of free data they can mine from your use of the tablet.  I'm sure there would be denials about that.And still a nice tablet, boots up fast, has many nice features,  Comparable to an iPad, and it has a micro SD port.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding product with amazing amounts of FREE stuff.
Reviews.Author: okiedan "Pro Bono Publico"
Reviews.Content: By the time I registered this and activated all the free software and programs I had reduced the price of this little dynamo down to around 50 bucks.I wrote a long review for the Note 12.2 so I am not going to repeat it all.  Suffice it to say this works pretty much like my larger version.I activated the tv link...which is really cool.  I only get over the air tv.  I cut the cable a few years ago and now rely totally on Netflix, Apple tv, and Amazon..... with a sprinkling of online content since my TVS all have wifi and are on my home network.I have used many different tablets.  The strong points for this one is the up to date OS and the huge amounts of free software.

Reviews.Title: Sigh
Reviews.Author: Abby 0001
Reviews.Content: Overall its a great prob. Doesnt lag as much as ppl say. Unfortunately, I seemed to have gotten one with a factory default. The brightness wont adjust so I cant see anything once its locked. Sent it back to get the problem rectified though. If it wasnt for that, I would have given this tablet 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: David Nickerson
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet computer and I like it a lot.  The display is very sharp and accurate.  Movies look great.  Sound is as expected, pretty bad, but it's not a hi-fi system either.  My only real complaint would be Samsungs online registration process.  I just seemed to go around and around and finally gave up.  I entered the data requested but it insisted that one of the number was wrong...oh well.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet on the market!
Reviews.Author: Travis Fandrich
Reviews.Content: Samsung has done it again!  I love the versatility of this tablet along with the fact that it blows the Ipad Air out of the water!  Better screen which gives better graphics, has a pen which makes it ideal for an artist or even simply writing something down quickly.  3 gigs of Ram makes this thing a dream to work with. Hands down the best tablet on the market!

Reviews.Title: Excllent Product
Reviews.Author: D. Coleman
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition is everything that a person would want. The images, speed, holding, are everything that I was looking for and then some. I do not see where anybody could have a problem with it.The setup was super easy and I really like the ability to write notes on it. Really comes in handy when you go somewhere like to the grocery store or anywhere you need a note.

Reviews.Title: I love my note 10.1!
Reviews.Author: Viridiana
Reviews.Content: The main reason is because is so similar to my phone that it has been so easy to get use to it.  Of course it has features that my phone doesn't have and it is being a big help at work, making presentations to clients on the go accessing my documents from there. Still trying to figure out how to save a signature from a client into a document. I know it could be done so if someone knows how to.... please let me know

Reviews.Title: Battery drained too fast.
Reviews.Author: Joseph Tsao
Reviews.Content: Screen gets locked up pretty offen, and system drains battery quite fast. Ok to my expectation, but stylish pen is pretty helpful.

Reviews.Title: Everything I was looking for in a tablet!
Reviews.Author: vunderstuff "uniquities from all over"
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure I wanted a 10 inch tablet but I had just returned the Dell Venue 8 (see my review for reasons on that) and I wanted to make sure the next tablet I got would be perfect. I had the Samsung rep at Best Buy give me a complete demo of the Samsung 10.1 2014 and it was unbelievably impressive!  The Wacom pen stylus is one of the features that sold me on the Samsung. An example is the Sketchbook pro Galaxy version that comes loaded on the tablet. You have a complete Sketchbook program included, that has a touch sensitive pen, multiple layering, pages of different brushes, plus you can automatically save your sketch to the gallery app. There are so many features of the stylus that you really need to watch a youtube or have a demo of them to get a true idea of how unique and useful they are.  As a first time tablet owner, everything on this table is very easy to learn and very intuitive. There has been almost no learning curve. I have owned the tablet for almost 3 months and have barely brushed the surface of all it can do. The battery life is extremely good, from watching videos to playing games, and I've encountered no problems at all with the tablet.  It has worked perfectly. although I have purchased the extended warranty for it from Amazon.  This is my first tablet purchase and now I can't imagine being without it.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: jonathan colondres
Reviews.Content: Take this with a grain of salt as I am a Samsung fan boi.  I always loved the high quality high resolution Wacom pen enabled screen. Device has a faux leather back, its plastic but has a decent feel.  OS is zippy no issues, great viewing angles and stereo volume is plenty for casual video consumption.  S Pen is a great tool, however for note taking I would suggest getting a Wacom bamboo feel.  This is my first experience with a tablet and its has been extremely positive so far.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Green Pond
Reviews.Content: I haven't found anything wrong with this tablet, The only flaw is me, the operator, however, I'm getting better every day as I discover the many capabilities of the tablet. The pen is a wonderful addition!

Reviews.Title: Bluetooth issues and screen wake up issues.
Reviews.Author: Eric L Penne
Reviews.Content: My son saw problems from day 1 with the bluetooth keyboard. We tried a Logitech and Rocketfish bluetooth keyboard. Both of them would routinely disconnect and have troubles reconnecting. The disconnection was fairly rapid and made the keyboard a non-practical item to use with the tablet. Further research shows this is a significant problem with this model of tablet. Others have complained of hissing with bluetooth speakers.After about a month, the screen went black in the lower left corner and didn't come back until we restarted the tablet. Shortly after that every time the tablet goes to sleep the screen won't come back. No backlight and it doesn't look like anything on the screen. The Menu, Home, and Return buttons light up and the haptic feedback from touching the screen is working but you can not see anything on the screen. The only way to get the screen back was booting into recovery mode. I tried clearing cache and then a full reset but the problem still existed.Since it was past the 30 day window for Amazon we have to wait for Samsung to do something. Woohoo! A $600 useless tablet!

Reviews.Title: Stop stalling, just get it.
Reviews.Author: Bob Combs
Reviews.Content: Couldn't wait for the supposed "nexus 10". This thing is amazing. Just wish it had kitkat instead of jelly bean.

Reviews.Title: Almost a Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Jnavian
Reviews.Content: Worked great for a week almost then the screen went black. Had to send in my tablet to samsung waiting until they fix it. So waiting on the verdict.

Reviews.Title: So far its ok, but the S pen is worthless
Reviews.Author: Pat S
Reviews.Content: Its ok, although the S pen is useless for me.  Maybe I need to practice but so far I've been through the tutorial and have not gotten one thing to work as advertised with the S pen.  Select and search don't work at all, the scrapbook is clumsy and difficult to use - and I cant get it to use handwriting anyway, even if I select the pen.  Tried the autoselect with the pen: I tried to write "Joy" for the email receipient, never even got the "J" written (although I figured how to erase, plenty of practice doing THAT!)I like the multi window, but it is so-so. I used it to copy a picture to an email and send it.  That worked sort of - once I dragged the picture onto the email everything seemed to freeze for over a minute.  The .jpg wasnt that big, 100 KB or so, shouldnt have taken that long.  I can think of no other use for multi window as I dont usually play Candy Crush while reading a Kindle book, or look at my 401K and Facebook together or whatever.  I've had this ability for the last thousand years or so (slight exaggeration) on my PC and never used it there either.Anyway bottom line: I like this tablet but truthfully its not that much better than my tab 2.  If you're thinking of getting one I'd suggest waiting until the next version.

Reviews.Title: A Little Bit of Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Chuck "CMB"
Reviews.Content: Well, I have to tell: this is the first Samsung product that I felt not that happy after purchase. I am a huge Samsung (actually Google and hence, Android) fan. I support most of Samsung's products because they are really high quality. But this tablet was different from others, because it is specialized so that you can use it as a notepad. However, it is not that comfy and useful, when you try to use it like a notepad. Actually, previous versions seem more handy than this 2014 edition. Well, I have to give Samsung this: this tablet is very fast and high quality. My problem has nothing to do with that. I think I expected a lot from S Note application and I was kind of disappointed. I just sold it after 1 week of use. If you guys want a tablet, don't hesitate and purchase this. But if you are looking for something to use as a notepad and write on it, go to Walmart and buy real papers and pen.

Reviews.Title: Awesome to draw
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Germenos R.
Reviews.Content: I had the iPad 1, iPad 2, iPad Mini. Then I got the Samsung Note 8", which allowed me to draw way better. When I found this Note, I just had to get it! It's resolution is amazing, and performs beautifully. I am a firm believer that you buy things that you use, and you get them for what you want to use. I was searching (since the first iPad) for a tablet that would allow me to draw, and I know there are Wacom tablets, but the price difference is huge, and you would need a Cintiq to get this experience! I also like being able to keep up to date in Facebook, Twitter, watch Netflix from time to time, but that's what every tablet does. Being able to write, or cut things to paste them anywhere else, is not.Awesome product!

Reviews.Title: i am very please!
Reviews.Author: Marcos E. Ruiz Rivero
Reviews.Content: after using another brand of tablet for two years, finally samunsg nailed it with this tablet, i am so please with it! the pen is super! i use it a lot specially during classes to make my notes, what else can i say but very please...

Reviews.Title: Bloatware wont stay gone but still good value for screen quality and storage.
Reviews.Author: Birdman
Reviews.Content: I run this device off a 12volt solar charging system in the sailboat I live in. I have an LG Motion 4g phone with a wifi hotspot feature and a downloaded foxfi app that enables me to use the Note while masking data usage .Saves exorbitant data charges.Foxfi has a free addon app that acts as a proxy server. Works flawlessly. The Note works as advertised. Ive had it a month or so and use every day for many functions. I send pictures from my phone or Fuji telephoto camera and store in the Note,filing in Dropbox which is also synced to phone.A really great way to save things. Picture quality on the Note is excellent and processing speeds are good .I upload alot of pictures to it using the eye fi mobi sd card in the camera.Camera to phone even when out of cellular range or straight to Note when its enabled. The Note is much faster on regular wifi than foxfi hotspot but thats to be expected. Still get respectable speeds using all the Notes features that Ive needed. There is way too much bloatware that doesnt stay force closed.

Reviews.Title: Thank You Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Mannesseh
Reviews.Content: Shipping - awesome speed!!a day ahead of time.... that's REALLY, REALLY cool!continue this type of customer service.Samsung ROCKS!  Love this 2014 Version of  Samsung's 10.1 Tablet with the S-Pen Technology...I have a Samsung Note 3 with the S-Pen technology... nothing beats this dynamic duo... Incredible!Thx again!ES-IPNW

Reviews.Title: VERY Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Whacko Wayneo "lawayne"
Reviews.Content: Not near as elegant a physical design as the Apple Air iPad, but the Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 is reasonably well-designed.  The operating system beats the iPad hands-down; more complex to learn, but is so much more flexible and powerful.  Apps can be highly integrated with the Android 4.2 operating system, unlike the iPad.  I have a Samsung Note 3 mobile phone, and this tablet uses the same user approach and stylus technology.  Make sure you get the 2014 version of this tablet.  A minor point: I wish the charger port were in a different location as it interferes with fully using my case in all configurations.  Note-taking with S-Note is amazing; it is very functional and can save your notes to picture or PDF format for mailing to others. See my reviews for the case that I really like for this device.  I wish the "menu" and "back" capacitive "buttons" were closer to the outer edges to make them easier to use with my case, but this is only a minor complaint.  The fact that it (and the Note 3 phone) actually have a "back" "button" is so helpful, unlike the iPhone/iPad which does not have one.  I have no issue with the size or design/build of the stylus.  32G of internal memory, with the ability to add up to a 64Gb microSD card is far better than how an iPad designs their approach to memory. Also, you can configure the closing of an app when you swith to a different display/functionality which helps battery life.  Otherwise, I end up with a zillion apps running in the background, thus draining my battery.

Reviews.Title: Loving it!!
Reviews.Author: Sonny delos Santos
Reviews.Content: Well it is my first tablet so I can't really compare it to any other tablet.  The selling point was the S-pen for me amongst the other great features that I am currently exploring at the moment.  The others used a stylus that was not as accurate when it came to drawing or PS.  This I experienced on my smart phone.  One of the things that does annoy me is the S-note, that it utilizes the whole screen in landscape and half the screen in portrait... Well back to playing with my new toy.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Wine Runner
Reviews.Content: I have had my tablet for one month. Overall it is very good. I use it for both work and personal applications. Being able to have two screens open at once is great. However, unless I'm missing something it only applies to such combinations as email/web browser. Essentially, anytime an app has an embedded link to another app. The rear camera is very good compared to comparable tablets. My only negative is that it doesn't have an HDMI slot.

Reviews.Title: love the galaxy note 10.1
Reviews.Author: N. Kappes "battrainer"
Reviews.Content: I like it because it mirrors my galaxy s4 phone. I am still learning all the features, the battery life us very goof. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition
Reviews.Author: SMS
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition.I already had a Samsung Galaxy S3 phone and having the ability to link them seamlessly was great.I'm able to access the internet without any problem and the video display is terrific for movies.A nice travel size tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Product provisioned by a great Company in Amazon
Reviews.Author: Ridimup
Reviews.Content: Bought this product and the SD Card reader wasn't reading the card as it should so I called Amazon first and was told to hang onto it until they ship me a new one. That they did in expeditious manner and the SD Card reader worked as it should, so I send back the defective one. So with that said... I LOVE AMAZON, because this was a hassle free return.Now onto the tablet, speed, look and the versatility is beyond question. I loaded some movies onto the sd card and the picture quailty was impeccable. The camera takes some wonderful pictures, e-mail, calendar. This is a mini computer at your disposal here. I am overly happy with it and glad I waited before I rush to buy any other tablet out there that does not have the flexibility to add, change or edit what you add. Did someone say Apple ipad? Yes, I do not like their monopoly they have  on their products.Get this product and start enjoying life on the go.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds my expectations
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received my  galaxy note yesterday and instantly fell in love. I did spend time personalizing it. I downloaded apps transfer music and pics. I am very impressed with how smooth it runs. I own Samsung galaxy s3 and wanted a tablet similar to my Phone. This exceeds my expectation. I look forward to adding movies and exploring features and specs. I will update my review when I have had a chance to explore.

Reviews.Title: Great but not with out some short coming
Reviews.Author: Fahd Almohid
Reviews.Content: The screen is very clear and the S pen works great yet the tablet itself isn't very responsive and it lags a little from time to time.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: traderpats
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my wife.  She loves it and has gotten to the point where it's her main computer.  The screen is simply gorgeous and no problems with the unit at all.  A good piece of hardware....

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Virginia L. W.
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I really enjoy it.  I use it more than I thought I would.  I like the quick response to the touch and the sharp picture.  I sometimes experience trouble with the screen capture, and mirror imaging to my Samsung SmartTV, but its a great product.  I would/do recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit for my wifes computing needs!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: No complicated laptop for her pupose, easy transition to tablet and works fast, works just like her galaxy s3 phone...

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32 GB, White)
Reviews.Author: Wendy Jeremie "Wendy Jeremie"
Reviews.Content: Great machine.  After searching so many tablets I decided on this one and have no regrets whatever.  I am in the process of learning how to use it and make use of all the features.  So far, it meets my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1
Reviews.Author: Lumingu LufuaLubobo
Reviews.Content: Satisfied, met my expectationVery simple to useGood comfort, thinFit any window Updated programsNice pictures and quick to process, high speed

Reviews.Title: nice tablet
Reviews.Author: paul van dyne
Reviews.Content: when i got it , it was like new, no wear and tear. , the person i got it from , given me a keyboard  and a carrying case which was real nice, , this is my 4th tablet,, and this is more like apples tablet,, has button to bring you back to main menu, sharp screen,  the only thing i do not like is the menu button on the outside of the screen, i keep hitting it by missake and it brings up google search,,  as of now , i can not see how to disable it,,  otherwise great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition
Reviews.Author: Harold D. Naber
Reviews.Content: I researched I pads, and other tablets, and decided on the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1, 2014 edition.  I am still learning how to use it, but so far am very satisfied.  One thing that swayed me toward the Samsung is the SD card slot and he higher quality cameras.  I have recommended this tablet to several people already.

Reviews.Title: Gift for Senior Citizen Parents
Reviews.Author: Rick Holcomb
Reviews.Content: Got it for my parents.  They absolutely love it.  While they haven't mastered everything on it, what they do use works well for them.Pros- S Pen, very usefull for them to use on keyboard and other buttons.  They don't use the more esoteric Spen functionality, but they have problems using keyboard with their fingers.  Spen makes it much easier for them.- intuitive User Interface.  My Dad who refused to have anything to do with computers uses this thing extensively.  He actually enjoys figuring out how to use it.  While he has a way to go fully master it (who ever figures out how to do everything on these things) he is doing remarkably well with it.  Far better than I ever expected.Cons- Various buttons along edge of system more or less unusable for them.  Not a major issue since they just never turn it off.- Deffinatly get a case for it.  For older folks, it seems to be hard to hold onto.  Easily solved by sticking it in something like the roocase.  Makes it much easier to hold onto and provides extra protection for an accidental drop.

Reviews.Title: recharging is lousy
Reviews.Author: gadget lover
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, so I don't have anything with which to compare. That being said, it is a neat gadget. However, it takes a really, really long time to charge up the battery. I have an iPod touch that charges up quickly. I was expecting a quick(er) charge, not over night and still not fully charged!

Reviews.Title: Excellent change, excellent product
Reviews.Author: Huang, Chang-wei "raptornomad"
Reviews.Content: An elegant and handy device that differentiate itself from other tablets. The included S pen and optimized apps which allows one to take notes is the reason I gave it a five star. TouchWiz UI could be more optimized in terms of more aggressive RAM management (like HTC's Sense 5.5), but the general usage of this device is smooth (not quite up to my expectations though). Colors on the screen is fantastic but the contrast is lacking. Battery life exceeded my expectations, easily lasting me over a day (usage included streaming Netflix, web browsing, Youtube-ing, Spotify-ing, note-taking...etc). This is not a tablet for everyone, but I closed my eyes and took the leap and the outcome is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Tablet
Reviews.Author: Edward Aviles
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet. I already owned a Galaxy Note 2 so acclimating myself to the OS was very easy. I was able to install the apps I had purchased for my phone onto the tablet which is great. There are too many great features to list but it is like having a Galaxy Note 2 or 3 on steroids. It does not lag, the screen resolution is unbelievable, and the sound (specially when using head phones) is incredible. I use a Windows 7 laptop for work and the two play together very nice as I am able to transfer files very easily. It also comes with Polaris Office 5 which is awesome. I had already purchased Quick Office Pro a year ago and Polaris is better as it allows you to modify PDF's and print directly to your wireless printer. For work productivity there isn't a better tablet on the market.

Reviews.Title: What's not to like
Reviews.Author: Kody Van Dyk
Reviews.Content: I chose this tablet in order to use in the field for reviewing engineering drawings with clients.  The stylus helps with making revisions on the fly.Batter life has been pretty good - so far.The Android OS is bulky and slow, but that is not Samsung's fault.
